instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi,
I found this values on <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>

1 : 0,4v
2 : 16,3v
3 : 3,06v
6 : 1,2v
7 : 2,3v
8 : 1,2v
10 : 0,6v

any idea ? :-) please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Pin 3 is the VIN, voltage in pin. We expect here DC in voltage or battery voltage. The battery is 11-12v, the DC in voltage should be 16v.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_OR_PBUS</SIGNAL> goes through <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> to send 16v to the voltage in pin. It also goes through <RESISTOR>R6993</RESISTOR> to enable the chip to turn on.

Since pin 2 is 16v, I can assume that <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_OR_PBUS</SIGNAL> is present. 

Since pin 3 is 3v, I can assume that either one of two things is true.

1) <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> is short circuiting pin 3 of <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> to ground.
2) <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> is blown.

It is possible both of the above are true. What is the resistance of <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR>? What is the resistance to ground at pin 3 of <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>? Measure without power applied of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
many thanks :-) (Louis ?) :-)
Yes the <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> was blown.. now I have the green light but no boot.
I found 3v3 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> and 3v41 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SMC_AVCC</SIGNAL>
and 3v4 on <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>
what's wrong ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
1) What voltage is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

2) If you measure the list of rails on page 7 of the schematic, what rails are present? What rails are missing?

Does <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulse when you plug in the charger? 

3) Are you using an original 85w charger?
